website_summaries.verdict: The best budget wheel chock to buy for smaller, lightweight vehicles. High-quality for a budget price.
pros: The heavy-duty construction features a tough plastic resin that can take the weight of smaller vehicles
Works with a variety of tire sizes commonly found on sedans and station wagons
cons: Not meant for commercial or heavier vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Not Heavy Duty - Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: They're advertised as heavy duty, but... they're actually just cheap plastic. It's hard to tell from the picture, but the inside is not solid, it's hollow. which means that the only support for all the weight of my trailer is on the sides of the chocks. That thin plastic just doesn't hold well. Mine broke after using them twice. Also, because they're hollow, the only contact they have with the ground is the perimeter of the chock, not the inside area. These slid on me several times before they broke. I'm just glad I still had the chains attached! I would recommend finding something made of solid rubber or at least thicker plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jaybird55

customer_reviews.title: UNSAFE at best
customer_reviews.text: “Heavy Duty” in the title. “Heavy Duty" in the description. NOT “Heavy Duty” in reality. These are flimsy, hollow, light-weight plastic stackable ramps. Might as well put a couple of red Solo cups behind your wheels. Might be good if you need to change the oil on your Power Wheels, but for any realistic applications, these are wildly unsafe. Working on your car is no time to skimp on safety. Spend the few extra dollars to get some solid rubber wheel chocks. For peace of mind if nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: James Willish

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Heavy Duty isn't a word I would use to describe these wheel chocks, one was broken on delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Junk pastic. Get a solid rubber choke
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time buying wheel chokes and these chokes are a joke. I guess it’s what you get for $5 or $6 It’s made of light plastic,and some wind could easily blow off right under your tire. I used my electric blower to clean off the brake dust and it blew it right off under the tire. It’s flimsy so you can’t really wedge it in between your tire. Also the material feel like it could crush easily. Since it’s platic and has no weight practically it could just slide off if your car moves. Don’t waste $5 or $6 on this plastic garbage and get a sold heavier choke.
customer_reviews.author: Caliguy

customer_reviews.title: They are very light duty wheel chalks I would maybe ...
customer_reviews.text: They are very light duty wheel chalks I would maybe trust for a riding lawn mower, Another thing is that is not mentioned in the description but is on the sticker of the product is NOT to use with wheels bigger than 20 inches in diameter... Fail
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 3000lb VW GTI
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I've used them multiple times now while working on the exhaust and also the intercooler pipes on my car. I have a 2015 VW GTI, which weighs around 3000lbs. Now, would I be using these on a huge, heavy truck or SUV? Probably not! But for my 3000lb car, they do their job. They stop the car from rolling, do not slide, and do not crush/break.
customer_reviews.author: Quebster

customer_reviews.title: This is a good set.  I am not sure how people are breaking these.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set of chocks. I used them this weekend while working on the car and they were flawless, durable and sturdy. I'm not sure how people are cracking these but I suspect they went over the recommended load or drove over them. While my car was on the jack stand, it shifted and wound up over the chocks. I dropped my car right in the middle of the chock and it just sat there with no issues. My whole rear was on top of 1 chock and it didn't flinch. Very good set and at a crazy low price too!
customer_reviews.author: klulu

customer_reviews.title: Functional but NOT heavy-duty.
customer_reviews.text: These wheel chocks are made from a thin layer of plastic. This plastic is very durable and kept the wheels of my 2001 Ford Focus supported while jacking it up to replace a wheel bearing BUT it is still only a couple of millimeters of plastic. Calling these wheel chocks heavy duty while other wheel chocks exist that are made of solid rubber is just a straight up lie. They will get the job done, but think twice if you have a real heavy duty application.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Not Useful For Safety Purposes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Suzuki Forenza for added security when changing a tire or parked on a hill. Made a lightweight plastic these would not hold my car in place. The other issue is that these are really small. Perhaps someone with a quad bike or motorcycle would be able to use them but I would not rely on them for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca AnneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: Been using these when working on an old Jeep Cherokee. On 2nd use, I was excited to test the new brakes and forgot to remove these lil guys. Though my E-brake was locked. Then I realized my rear wheels were spinning...went back and removed the chocks - absolutely no damage despite my dumb mistake. Would absolutely recommend to anyone who needs quality chocks at a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Fellowes

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, but they work for light duty
customer_reviews.text: These are advertised as "heavy duty". If you define that as "able to stand under their own weight" then sure, heavy duty. But I wouldn't expect them to hold back a car on even a slight gradient. They're made of flimsy plastic. I can bend them with the fingers of one hand. I relegate them to light duty, like changing a tire on a level surface while the car is supported by heavy duty jack stand and the parking brake is applied. There is absolutely no way I would actually get underneath my car while using these. They would probably be okay if you were working on a little red Radio Flyer wagon.
customer_reviews.author: Hooliator

customer_reviews.title: Did their job, but get a bigger and more solid one.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, and this was cheap, but it is cheap. They do work in the sense they chock your tires, but they're somewhat weak plastic if put in a bind. They have already been crushed by my trailer, hauling my Kubota tractor, after I parked it on a slight incline. It's partly my fault as they were a little crooked under the tires, and they did keep it from rolling farther, but they crushed under less than 4 tons of weight of the trailer and tractor. I'll buy solid rubber next time as well as a bit bigger chock. But they did their job.
customer_reviews.author: Jim from Ky.

customer_reviews.title: Lt Wt but Strong Enough if Placed/Used Correctly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because they are light weight and compact enough to stay inside my vehicle. Have used these numerous times while off-roading and in the driveway and they work just fine. Made it easier and faster than finding a rock, and so far I haven't had any problem with them standing up to the abuse of bouncing around in my recovery kit or the weight of a 6k lb vehicle. That said they are vulnerable to lateral/side pressure so if you're real abusive with your gear then you should pick something more robust.
customer_reviews.author: mark l donald

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Piece of Wood At Home Store
customer_reviews.text: Heavy Duty? Seriously, these are way too small to be HEAVY DUTY! Amazon should remove this item for false advertising. These are only good for very small tires and not heavy duty as advertised. This item is a JOKE!
customer_reviews.author: S. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: LIGHT WEIGHT
customer_reviews.text: Just so everybody knows, the ad says "2 PAIR" but you are only going to get one pair (2 chocks) not two pair ( four chocks). I think they need to change the way the ad is worded. If I have one pair of socks, it means I have two socks, right and left. If I have two pairs of socks, it means I have four socks. The ad is misleading. YOU ONLY GET TWO CHOCKS. That being said, I think the chocks are doing the job and worth the money I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great for light  Trailers
customer_reviews.text: I see what other people are saying about the flimsy and thin material, but they work well for me. I place them behind my small utility trailer, and even with full load on a hill and they held solid. For a car/suv/truck I don't think they would do much. I really didn't think they would grip on the asphalt and concrete due to the little feet nubs on the bottom, but for my utility trailer i have never had them fail. Nice and cheap for the pair. I have been pretty rough this summer with them and they have held up to throwing them around, being on the grass, asphalt, cement, gravel and even sand.
customer_reviews.author: Rydean D.

customer_reviews.title: This should be great for our little fishing boat.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been using blocks of wood. But every time I pick up the wood I get a splinter. So I think these will be much better to put behind the wheels of our little trailer that the boat is on. It will be much safer and more sturdy to keep the trailer in place. Especially when we put in our toy hauler trailer so as we are driving it won't move around.
customer_reviews.author: Joni Nielson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen some of the reviews on here, and yes they are lightweight. Having said that, yesterday I used them for the first time for my oil change. They fit perfectly under both rear tires, and my car didn’t move at all. For me they were just right, I felt safe doing my oil change, and I know I’m not going to have to hunt for rocks if I ever get a flat tire. I feel they’ll be just as safe if I have to change a tire on the road. I’d recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: LSL308

customer_reviews.title: Good for lightweight application
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, these are plastic and very light weight. They will work for me as I'm using them on level ground on my light old Honda CR-V and just jacking up one tire at a time and not very high to flip brake pads. I would not recommend these for larger trucks/SUVs or if your working on an incline. Like lots of products, if it fits your application, it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: Jim2day

customer_reviews.title: Great Chocks for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I had all my stuff stored in my garage and couldn't find my metal "Big Red" chocks and needed some cheap ones in a hurry to work on my car. For them to be plastic, they're actually very sturdy. Unlike some other reviewers I was not able to drive over them with my civic or my wife's altima. Honestly I feel like those people had to have felt the car stop and gunned the car to get it moving. Or maybe they don't know to actually how to use them, beats me. These things are rock solid and for the price you can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Move On!
customer_reviews.text: Vendor describes wheel chocks as "heavy duty?" Well, no, unless this is one of those call it opposite of what it is. Not as thick as a frisbee, not as sturdy as your last paper plate at a barbecue and not by any definition heavy duty. Currently using a tree branch instead.
customer_reviews.author: Aspen Hill

customer_reviews.title: Work well for my Porsche
customer_reviews.text: Not really heavy duty. These are made of plastic and a lighter weight. They do work well to hold my Porsche in place when up on a ramp. I just need something light and to hold the front in place when I back up on the ramps to change oil or jack it up to pull off wheels. For the price - you get what you pay for. These are not heavy duty solid rubber chocks. They are plastic with a bottom grip to hold in place.
customer_reviews.author: RBW

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for mid size car or larger.
customer_reviews.text: Imagine the smallest wheel chock you would trust your life to and then half that. That would be the size of these. Meant for something like a golf cart or very light utility trailer. Only on a solid rough surface that these could grab onto; they are hollow and slick plastic. Not for a mechanic or truck driver; etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tm

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, flimsy, dangerous...
customer_reviews.text: They are cheap, what do you expect. I used these while changing the oil in my 2004 Subaru Legacy, a small car compared to the "economy" car of today. They didn't grip until a few inches of rolling backwards, then i forgot to remove them after the job was completed and they snapped right in half, even with a car that weighs less than 2500LB. Useful for quick jobs that you generally don't need to go under the car for, otherwise get something better and more reliable...
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I will recomend this product for your needs.
customer_reviews.text: I used this item for both of my cars one of them is a regular car and the other is a UV which it will weight more than regular, good quality and pretty resistant item. the reason I won't give it 5 starts is because when you try to go over the ramp it keep pushing the ramp away. I will recommend the manufacture to install rubbers on the bottom of the ramps to prevent going away.
customer_reviews.author: drivas909

customer_reviews.title: Not to be trusted with your life (which is why you buy these...)
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have pointed out, they are very flimsy and do not provide much grip on smooth concrete surfaces. They were super cheap, so I'm not too disappointed, but I wouldn't trust my life to them. Spend a little extra money and get something that isn't junk. EDIT: Changed my oil last week and used them to chock my small sized, econobox sedan while it was up on ramps. I forgot to remove them when I was done and tried to back the car off the ramp anyways, and they provided no resistance at all. I didn't even notice until after the car was off the ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Heisenberg

customer_reviews.title: You DO get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: And in this case- not much! These might work to restrain a tiny utility trailer that weighs just a few hundred pounds on a near-flat surface. But that's all. They are essentially glorified Tupperware containers. Better description would be: "Heavy Duty Doorstop".
customer_reviews.author: John R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and stackable.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for our camper trailer, works great on just about all surfaces ( smooth concrete not the best) they are light and stackable for easy storage. The grips on the bottom really help hold them in place.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: These wheel Chocks are perfect for use with light trailers on a fairly flat surface to prevent movement. I use them in my 14" camper (>3000lb.) in conjunction with the ground stabilizers, but due to how light weight they are I would not recommend them for heavy trailers, drastic slopes or for use when jacking up and working on a vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lombard

customer_reviews.title: Best product quality for the category
customer_reviews.text: Really surprised how sturdy these are still have them and the quality of the plastic is outstanding i have had heavy tools metal and oth syuf drop on them in when not in use and they look brand new my friends got some budget brand and now use mine when they need it because theres broke and mine is still kicking ass
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Would not describe this product as heavy duty. Bought for use with my RV and went and bought a true heavy duty block. If we were ever parked on fairly uneven ground my RV could easily run over these flimsy things and break them to pieces
customer_reviews.author: Frank H. Gell III

customer_reviews.title: Great wheelbarrow chocks.
customer_reviews.text: These are great if you are planning to use them as wheelbarrow chocks. As for using them with any kind of automobile — I would definitely say look elsewhere. They are tiny and made of very thin plastic. I would definitely not trust my car or life with these toys.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Jam

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These don't seem like something that I'd safely expect to protect me from a vehicle that might roll back or forward, but they are built well enough to do the job even though my first impression was that they were too light duty to hold the car. I was going to give these four stars but really, for the money I'd say they are five star. I mean, they were meant to hold a car (van even) on a fairly level surface from a stationary position and they did the job well, at least on asphalt where I used them.
customer_reviews.author: BautistaVids

customer_reviews.title: Chock full of functionality
customer_reviews.text: They kept my car from moving while changing brakes and shocks. The chocks feel very sturdy and have a sawtooth edge on the bottom for better grip. If you’re worried about vehicle stability while it’s on a jack/jack stands I’d definitely recommend picking these up. Or, you could just cut a 4x4 in half. Whichever works for you.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Use for utility trailer or something small
customer_reviews.text: These are very light. I had doubts when I opened the package that they would hold well. I was wrong, they hold the trailer great. I wouldn't use on an rv or big boat. But for a utility trailer it works great for.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: It's just OK, no it's not it's junk
customer_reviews.text: Way too small, not even close to be wide enough. This is on my do not buy list. If I had known that it was so narrow, I would have bought to sets that way I can put 2 for one wheel, 2 per wheel would be perfect. I might have to get another set to do just that.
customer_reviews.author: Myanu

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty is such a loosely used term these days.
customer_reviews.text: Very light duty. Maybe I didn't read too closely, but they are smaller than I expected and my Jeep Wrangler nearly crushed these while I was trying to winch a tree. I imagine they would be fine for just keeping a car or trailer from rolling, but I don't consider that to be heavy duty use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy NJ

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: People are complaining about the cheapness of these but they does the job. If you need to to keep the car from rolling so you can safely change a tire then they are good. Need something for more than that then buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dogg

customer_reviews.title: Decent for $6...
customer_reviews.text: They do the job but are extremely cheap and thin. If u turn upside down they are just hollow a thin shell. All they donis orevent wheel from rolling back and do a good job... but if anything really gave and the full weight kd the car was thrust against them i dont know if i could trust them. Also to properly use them u are suppose to have two per tire front and back side. Or at least if u only put on back side put a 2x4 on the front side of tires so they cant roll either way.
customer_reviews.author: Pitty

customer_reviews.title: Tough, stackable, reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: They work well and they do their job. I was impressed with how sturdy they were when I accidentally backed over them and they didnt even crack. They stack together nicely in do not take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: lmag

customer_reviews.title: too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I should have realized by the cheap price that these wheel chocks are too light and flimsy to be considered a heavy duty item. They work OK, but seem way too flimsy to me. I felt better replacing them with a rubber set at Harbor Freight.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: These chocks are made for stopping
customer_reviews.text: I use these for added protection when changing the oil of my 2012 Sienna. A couple of bucks for piece of mind is a small price to pay. That and I love looking like I know what I'm doing. Seriously, be safe if you are gonna work on a vehicle, buy these. They were made for safety purposes and cost very little. If they work on my 8 passenger van...you get the point. I take no responsibility for how you use them.
customer_reviews.author: Pilar G. Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: What was I thinking. These are terrible and I can't believe I bought them. Maybe they'd be fine to hold a tiny trailer on sod or hard packed dirt but I can't imagine these would do much for a car or truck on a concrete driveway. Oh well... something else for the Goodwill pile.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I'm just not going to recommend it to anyone looking to buy these wheel chocks
customer_reviews.text: You get what you Pay for! I've always been and always will be a believer of paying a little more for quality items. In FloTool's defense, I do my homework when buying stuff online and the only time I don't do my homework.... I get a product not to my standard. My first impression of the (FloTool 11930MI Heavy Duty Wheel Chocks) was, Holy Nachos, what on earth did I order. I'm not blaming the FloTool 11930MI Heavy Duty Wheel Chocks for the product I've purchased, I'm just not going to recommend it to anyone looking to buy these wheel chocks. So Please spend a little extra and purchase a better quality wheel chocks.
customer_reviews.author: Mertato1

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty impressed...was worried the low cost might mean poor performance. We used two pair to chock the opposite tires while installing new rims on a Jeep Commander and "Beastie" didn't budge one mm. We're going to purchase a pair for each family vehicle to stick in the trunk for roadside tire changes. I DID NOT RECEIVE A DISCOUNT FROM ANYONE FOR THIS REVIEW; HOWEVER, FLOTOOL IF YOU'RE OUT THERE AND YOU WANT TO GIVE ME SOME MONEY I'M DOWN WITH THAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Devil

customer_reviews.title: Good for small cars
customer_reviews.text: Been using these while working on my BMW and Lexus F Sport and they seem to work well. Made in the USA and inexpensive, defiantly get yourself a set!
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: they didn't hold much
customer_reviews.text: Unhooked 7k trailer. Heard a snap. Realized trailer smashed one just from static weight. luckily it hit against a heavy bumper and stopped. Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: On the light side of heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: These chocks are a little lighter weight than I expected. They appear to be made of rubber in the photos, but they are instead a heavy plastic. They are a little smaller than I expected. That said, they do work well to keep my RV from moving, and that is just what I needed them for. They also nest with each other, so that takes up less storage space. No complaints, but I wouldn't use them on a really large vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Someone Else

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly sturdy. I forgot I had them behind my wheels when I lowered me truck. After the truck wouldn’t budge I remembered! Very strong.
customer_reviews.author: GRC

customer_reviews.title: Holds vehicle in place.
customer_reviews.text: Helps hold your car or van in place while lifting or working underneath. Left my vehicle in neutral on a slopped driveway by accident and these held the car from moving.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious with heavy vehicles.
customer_reviews.text: These worked well. I would hesitate to use on a very large/ heavy vehicle. I allowed my car (~3800 lbs) to roll slightly on to them in neutral to make sure I had a snug fit before jacking the rear end up. The back of the ramp was somewhat crushed and parts of the plastic turned white from the stress. With that said, they worked well and I saw no sign that the car was apt to move once I got it set up. They seem to be fine for re-use, but I would probably shy away from using on my pickup or a heavy vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had thought
customer_reviews.text: There is no rubber pad underneath wheel chock to prevent it from sliding. There are holes in wheel chock that it would make sense where rubber pad can be adhere.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: even though for normal applications i am sure they would perform just fine, but better safe than sorry IMO
customer_reviews.text: I didnt really look at them when I ordered them and assumed they were solid. Lazy to send them back so I just filled them with cement I had around, just dont trust anything made of plastic lol, even though for normal applications i am sure they would perform just fine, but better safe than sorry IMO. Wasnt worth the trouble to send them back and order new ones for only 9$.
customer_reviews.author: NwolfZ

customer_reviews.title: Good tire stopper
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our camper. They are very light weight and are good as tire blocks. They are made out of plastic so we shall see how long they last before it breaks. But so far it’s okay. Would have given it 5 star but being plastic I’m not sure how long it would last or if using it on a big pick up truck would it hold.
customer_reviews.author: tvang

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but it works
customer_reviews.text: They are cheap and OK Designed to be used on earth surface ground. If used on concrete on smooth surface they will have no traction to do their job. Put a rug, mat, or a rubber mat under them if using in concrete surface, etc. The little teeth on underside will grab into the mat and hold on. Remember to put two on each wheel. So you'll need 4 to properly hold the wheels down since the car can roll either direction. Walmart has the same thing for similar price if you don't want to wait.
customer_reviews.author: Sora

customer_reviews.title: Worked as described
customer_reviews.text: I used these when changing my rotors on a 2018 Honda Accord. The electronic parking brake needed to be disengaged and these did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: AntLeeWill

customer_reviews.title: In need a stronger surface at the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: I feel it needs some sort of rubber or other more saw like surface at the bottom. It keeps the car from rolling on a flat surface, but I wouldn't trust it on a little slanted/angled surface. the harbor freight which are made from rubber only cost $2 more.. (this was an add on for $5+)
customer_reviews.author: Asop Levy

customer_reviews.title: brittle
customer_reviews.text: very brittle, third use and the brittle plastic has broken apart. I do no recommend for serious daily use. it could hurt someone.
customer_reviews.author: Chupacabara

customer_reviews.title: Safety First
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to slide behind the rear tires of my mower when I use a mower lifter to raise the mower front. As the production description indicates you get two chocks for a low price. They are light in weight and stack together for storage. I use a MoJack mower lifter and the manual recommends the use of wheel chocks. Even without that recommendation I use these chocks because the cost of around five bucks is a small price to pay for added safety when doing dangerous work such as getting under a lifted lawn mower. As the old expression goes "better safe than sorry".
customer_reviews.author: Duffer.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight but seems to do the job
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit disappointed with these. They are quite thin and hollow inside. They do not give me the confidence level that it would stop my car, even though they probably do. Oh well, add-on item worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: MPL

customer_reviews.title: plastic
customer_reviews.text: not heavy duty, light weight plastic and doea not grip well
customer_reviews.author: Brad S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to prevent my husband's civic from rolling back off the RhinoGear ramps while changing out his oxygen fuel sensor. They were recommended to me by my father who uses them to chock our 15' flat trailer and our 12' tool trailer. I feel confident recommending these for use on flat surfaces as well as small (1-2% grade) inclines. I don't really like the feel of the plastic which lost it a star.
customer_reviews.author: CLC

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Really nice chocks. We own two pairs and they stack nicely in a tire or our camper's pass through storage.
customer_reviews.author: Garrison Householder

customer_reviews.title: Very study!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for years and for how cheap they are they are very well made. I use them on a 22 foot travel trailer and they've never failed me.
customer_reviews.author: BRYAN

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm totally satisfied with these Hopkins Heavy Duty Wheel Chocks. I have only used them with a riding lawnmower, but am sure they'd hold large vehicles in place just as well. Heavy duty, indeed! I would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Capps

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in how light weight they are. They tend to slide rather than keep my trailer from in place. They were good price but I would have preferred to pay more and get a more solid item.
customer_reviews.author: Derrill Heinecke

customer_reviews.title: Too light weight.
customer_reviews.text: They work reasonably well. However, I didn't investigate them enough. I went by their looks. I thought they would be much more robust that they actually turned out to be. I thought, at first look, they were solid rubber. Instead they are just relatively thin molded plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Erroll D.

customer_reviews.title: Does the Trick
customer_reviews.text: Got these because last time I was parked on a slope my RV trailer started to move. Now I am happy things stay put! I set them behind the tire and roll the camper back a little to ensure they are well seated behind the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: They are smaller and lighter weight than I expected. For general purposes they would be fine, but for something larger, a sturdier piece would be needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Lightweight and sturdy enough for SUVs
customer_reviews.text: One of the best basic tool in my tool library/ arsenal ONLY because it is compact and stackable thus minimizes storage space it needs.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Manaf

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Seems like they could be a little sturdier, but I've used them multiple times with my SUV and floor jack over the last month and they haven't failed me yet.
customer_reviews.author: ghostwriter

customer_reviews.title: This product works.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for great customer service. The delivery driver left my package in a very safe area inside my front yard before driving off. The product itself is very lightweight, very easy to store, durable, and relevant.
customer_reviews.author: Willie W

customer_reviews.title: Plastic will slide on the floor
customer_reviews.text: These are plastic, and don't feel very "heavy duty". They slid on my garage concrete floor because there is no rubber or "grip" material on the bottom. If you get these, test them on your floor before trusting them 100%. I am ordering rubber ones to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: JKC

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: While in place behind the wheels of my small camper and as I was raising the front end of my camper tongue to hitch it up - I heard a snap. Went around the camper and found the back of the chock had snapped off. This was only the second time I used them. Spend a little more and get solid chocks. These are made of thin plastic.
customer_reviews.author: "n4xmj"

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty!  Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: All it took was a really strong storm with high wind gusts to blow my trailer over both wheel chocks. Now I have two front corner leveling jacks to replace because they both got torn off by my trailer rolling backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: SAFETY
customer_reviews.text: I own a golf cart and have a 2 year old. I noticed she really want to hit the brake and gas petals all the time. Then she did it once and the golf cart started rolling with her in it. Thank God I was beside it. These were a great deal and of course my daughter is priceless. Works perfect. It has come in handy 1 time so far. I don't want to use them. But know they work now.
customer_reviews.author: Salon Adelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance/Low Price
customer_reviews.text: These hold my Airstream on a sloped driveway. Despite being light plastic, feels very solid when in use. I haven't tried it on all surface materials, so we'll see how they survive the season. Overall, I'm happy to have these in the toolbox. I've used these on asphalt and concrete so far with great results.
customer_reviews.author: M&S

customer_reviews.title: These are hollow plastic wheel chocks. Pro: they ...
customer_reviews.text: These are hollow plastic wheel chocks. Pro: they nest, meaning they take up less storage space than solid rubber chocks. Con: they do not have as much holding power as solid rubber chocks. Especially on slippery surfaces such as trailer ramps these tend to slide with the car rather than hold the car in position. These chocks work acceptably well on flat surfaces when the vehicle does not require much effort to keep in place.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Black

customer_reviews.title: Great for camper
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, sturdy, gets the job done cheap. Bought for our pop up camper, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Barry

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price...
customer_reviews.text: It's holding a 3400 lbs vehicle on a 3 degree incline with no problem. Priced right, but I wouldn't use them for anything heavy duty. If you're just trying to chock your ground wheels while on floor stands, these will do.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Niewiroski Jr.

customer_reviews.title: FloTool 11930MI Heavy Duty Wheel Chocks, Set of...
customer_reviews.text: very light weight and skids on the concrete. Not bad but would recommend getting a stronger/sturdier set. I really don't see where this is a "Heavy Duty Wheel Chock" set. I do not feel comfortable using them on my mower-when changing blades. Right now, I am using them as door stops in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for light duty applications
customer_reviews.text: Like the price and works fine. I wouldn't trust for a heavy duty application though.
customer_reviews.author: The Paw

customer_reviews.title: excellent value
customer_reviews.text: great value for the price, half of that from Harbor Freight and yet better quality.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Technically, not for normal sized wheels
customer_reviews.text: Used on 31" tall wheels.... (toyota tacoma) directions say not to do this. Wish that was made OBVIOUSLY clear before purchasing. Officially rated for wheels 22" and less (or something similar that is ridiculous ludicrous). I've experienced no issues. I let my car fully roll into the chocks then apply parking brake and gear before lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Bad product!
customer_reviews.text: If your lawnmower gets near it they blow away from your trailer tires!
customer_reviews.author: l brady steward

customer_reviews.title: Easy to throw in the back of the car
customer_reviews.text: A must-have for handymen and home mechanics. If your driveway is on a slope, you need this. If your car is on a ramp, you need this. Pros: - Very strong. - Light weight. - Stackable. Easy to throw in the back of the car. Cons: - None so far!
customer_reviews.author: GGSM Mobile

customer_reviews.title: Great for in vehicle roadside kits!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for smaller passenger vehicles and I love the nesting feature which makes them great to keep in the vehicle for those roadside emergencies/assistance and or at home use. Unfortunately they were a little small for the oversized tires on my jeep but the product seems to be sound thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Patriot 41

customer_reviews.title: Total crap
customer_reviews.text: Total crap. We bought these so we would have them to use on our new custom built cornhole game. We waited a while for our game to be built. Very FIRST game we finally got to use them, they fell apart at the seams. Literally. Went to return them and of course the time had expired. I refuse to sew these p.o.s. back together after one use! Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Lab Tech

customer_reviews.title: Must have for safety
customer_reviews.text: If you do suspension or brake work on your cars, get two of these and chuck the tires on the opposite side to where you are working; both front and back, so you will need 4 of these and each set has 2
customer_reviews.author: FlyingSandal

customer_reviews.title: Used these yesterday.
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts.. sitting on down slope ice, winching out a vehicle started sliding, put these in front of front tires, no more slide.. made of plastic, but they work.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Just plain plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Based on the description, I thought the DCB heavy duty, in that they would be made of some strong material. They are cheap plastic, and you better have something grippy on the floor otherwise it’s not going to hold anything.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: Not so heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Broke, as indicated in the picture, during first use. Vehicle drove up on them slightly while positioning vehicle on my ramps. These are not solid.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Hard Shelled Plastic, Sure?
customer_reviews.text: For the price and as an add-on Item i figured i'd give it a try. They seem to do the job, but I would rather have purchased something more solid or with a flat base. I don't feel that they are totally secure on the uneven surface, feel like they could skid away, though hasn't happened yet. But Better than not taking the extra step to chock the wheels!
customer_reviews.author: Nikolaos E Vitoroulis Jr

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic wheel locks. Reading the description I thought it was a heavy, good quality wheel lock. It’s cheap lightweight plastic that already broke.
customer_reviews.author: HarryL

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective.
customer_reviews.text: These work great. Inexpensive but they get the job done. I pulled out accidentally while one was still in place and it didn’t break but still prevented me from moving it very far. Does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Milt Drucker

customer_reviews.title: Handy chocks - just put them to work the last 2 days.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these this fall and just put them to use the last 2 days. So much lighter and better than the 4x4 blocks I have been using. Very light and they nest. I'm getting a pair to put in the trunk of each car. Wish I'd done this years ago. Seem to grip on my concrete garage floor and should work well on a gravel shoulder of a road. I rated 4 star as I can't speak for long term durability. So inexpensive they are easily replaced or have extras for spares as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie W. Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Very important to have traveling
customer_reviews.text: I bought a hydrolic jack because the ones they put in cars is terrible. I wanted to make sure that if I pulled over in on a incline my truck won’t roll. Every car should have these.
customer_reviews.author: Siberian wolf

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, light, effective
customer_reviews.text: These tire chocks are not built to withstand the apocalypse; however, they are an effective means of stopping your tires from rolling. I used them to secure my vehicle from rolling while changing a starter recently, and I forgot about them after taking the car down off the jacks. When I went to move said car (under the power of the engine), the blocks stopped the car from moving. I'm sure I could have driven over them had I punched the gas, but the point is that they are effective and resilient.
customer_reviews.author: Jay George

customer_reviews.title: Nice and simple and it works just as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and simple and it works just as advertised. I like that it's light and compact so it's easy to store away. The wheel chocks hold my car very well when I have either the front or back lifted at a time. It does its job to keep my car nice and secure so it doesn't roll back at all.
customer_reviews.author: Smatthew45

customer_reviews.title: good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I expected it be a little bigger, but it works fine
customer_reviews.author: Ali K.

product_meta.title: Hopkins FloTool 11930MI Heavy Duty Wheel Chock, (Pack of 2)
product_meta.description: FloTool, by Hopkins Manufacturing, offers the most comprehensive and highest quality offering of fluid handling products. Driven by innovative, no-mess product solutions, whether you’re changing your oil, topping off the antifreeze, or checking all your automotive fluid levels, FloTool has the right application. FloTool's Heavy Duty Wheel Chocks are a much needed safety devices when maintenance your vehicle or trailer. Heavy duty resin construction, designed to last.
feature_bullets: Safety device to use with ramps or other lifting devices
Stackable, nestable design for easy and convenient storage
Constructed of heavy duty resin material for ultimate durability and long-lasting usage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,647 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
